Would this be the place to ask?
Hello?

oh, ok.
I was wondering if I download a program from firefox
and it gives a .tar
where do I extract it to so that ubuntu considers it an installed program?
Yes, this is my first ubuntu install
I'm running the newest version, by the way

for a pre-compiled tarball like firefox uses, it doesn't really matter where it is. it's statically compiled. you can run it from anywhere, as long as the thing to double click stays in the same spot in its untar'd directory
what you CAN do is make a launcher and tell it the path to wherever you stashed it
https://launchpad.net/~mozillateam/+archive/firefox-next
there should be a way to make that launcher in the menu, but i use kubuntu so dont knw how to do it in ubuntu
i'm not sure why you need a static firefox though. firefox should be included in your ubuntu install
which version of ubuntu?
you just need to install updates :)
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
or use update-manager
you don't need to get firefox from a random point on the internet. it's in the repositories as version 5. there is an update available for your ubuntu to get it
the ubuntu mozilla team maintains a repository for the beta, linked above
somewhere in software center (sorry, i use kubuntu not ubuntu) there should be a way to add that repository
